Package projects.phonebook.hashes

Class SeparateChainingHashTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.phonebook.hashes.SeparateChainingHashTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HashTable
    public class SeparateChainingHashTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements HashTable

    SeparateChainingHashTable is a HashTable that implements Separate Chaining as its collision resolution strategy, i.e the collision chains are implemented as actual Linked Lists. These Linked Lists are not assumed ordered. It is the easiest and most " natural " way to implement a hash table and is useful for estimating hash function quality. In practice, it would not be the best way to implement a hash table, because of the wasted space for the heads of the lists. Open Addressing methods, like those implemented in LinearProbingHashTable and QuadraticProbingHashTable are more desirable in practice, since they use the original space of the table for the collision chains themselves.

    Author:
    YOUR NAME HERE!
    See Also:
    HashTable, SeparateChainingHashTable, LinearProbingHashTable, OrderedLinearProbingHashTable, CollisionResolver

    • Constructor Detail

      • SeparateChainingHashTable

        public SeparateChainingHashTable()
        Default constructor. Initializes the internal storage with a size equal to the default of PrimeGenerator.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public Probes put​(java.lang.String key,
                  java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from interface: HashTable
        Inserts the pair <key, value> into this. The container should not allow for null keys and values, and we will test if you are throwing a IllegalArgumentException from your code if this method is given null arguments! It is important that we establish that no null entries can exist in our database because the semantics of HashTable.get(String) and HashTable.remove(String) are that they return null if, and only if, their key parameter is null. This method is expected to run in amortized constant time.
        Specified by:
        put in interface HashTable
        Parameters:
        key - The record's key.
        value - The record's value.
        Returns:
        The Probes with the value added and the number of probes it makes.

      • get

        public Probes get​(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: HashTable
        Get the value associated with key in the HashTable. This method is expected to run in amortized constant time.
        Specified by:
        get in interface HashTable
        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        Returns:
        The Probes with associated value and the number of probe used. If the key is null, return value null and 0 as number of probes; if the key dones't exists in the database, return null and the number of probes used.

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey​(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: HashTable
        Queries the HashTable about the existence of the key key in its internal storage. This method is expected to run in amortized constant time.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • containsValue

        public boolean containsValue​(java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from interface: HashTable
        Queries the HashTable about the existence of the value value in its internal storage. This method is expected to run in linear time (i.e containsValue() is expected to be an inefficient operation. This is to be expected, since this HashTable hashes \ keys, not values.
        Specified by:
        containsValue in interface HashTable
        Parameters:
        value - The value to search for.
        Returns:
        true if key is the key of some record in our hash table, false otherwise.

      • size

        public int size()
        Description copied from interface: HashTable
        Returns the number of records in this HashTable. Please note that this is not the same as returning the hash table's capacity in Open Addressing collision resolution schemes (like Linear Probing)!
        Specified by:
        size in interface HashTable
        Returns:
        The number of records stored in this.

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        Description copied from interface: HashTable
        Returns the capacity of this HashTable. In Separate Chaining, this is the total number of cells from which the lists begin. In Open Addressing methods, this method returns the size of the underlying array. As a consequence, in SeparateChainingHashTable, it's possible for HashTable.size() to return a value larger than this method. On the other hand, for Open Addressing methods like LinearProbingHashTable and QuadraticProbingHashTable, the value returned by this method is an upper bound on the value returned by HashTable.size().
        Specified by:
        capacity in interface HashTable
        Returns:
        the number of cells in the table.

      • enlarge

        public void enlarge()
        Enlarges this hash table. At the very minimum, this method should increase the capacity of the hash table and ensure that the new size is prime. The class PrimeGenerator implements the enlargement heuristic that we have talked about in class and can be used as a black box if you wish.
        See Also:
        PrimeGenerator.getNextPrime()

      • shrink

        public void shrink()
        Shrinks this hash table. At the very minimum, this method should decrease the size of the hash table and ensure that the new size is prime. The class PrimeGenerator implements the shrinking heuristic that we have talked about in class and can be used as a black box if you wish.
        See Also:
        PrimeGenerator.getPreviousPrime()
